meanings.definition: A cathode-ray tube used to record television programs.
meanings.sent1: The kinescope displayed the old TV show in black and white.
meanings.sent2: I watched a classic movie on a kinescope last night.
meanings.sent3: The kinescope seemed to capture the past in its glowing screen.
meanings.sent4: Her memories played back like a kinescope in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The kinescope flickered with images of the bygone era.

meanings.definition: A recording made on a kinescope.
meanings.sent1: The kinescope recording preserved the historic event for future generations.
meanings.sent2: We found an old kinescope of a famous speech in the archives.
meanings.sent3: The kinescope recording brought laughter to the audience as they watched the blooper reel.
meanings.sent4: His words echoed through time like a kinescope replaying the past.
meanings.sent5: The kinescope captured the essence of the moment with its grainy footage.
